title: Holy War? | Christian Views on War
description:
As the Russian invasion of the Ukraine rages on, Christians find themselves again wrestling with the complexities of war and Christian theology. American Christians in particular have a complex relationship with war and violence.
In this video, I will lay out three historic Christian positions on the subject of war, including the position that seems to be held by the pro-Putin and pro-war Patriarch Kirill of the Russian Orthodox Church, and I'll explain what makes navigating these options so challenging. While doing so, I will also argue for what I think is the best position on war for Christians to hold to today.

To support this channel and podcast on Patreon:
https://www.patreon.com/posts/61462284

_________________________
ABOUT:
Paul Anleitner holds degrees in history from the University of Michigan & a Master's in Christian Thought from Bethel Seminary (St. Paul, MN) where he graduated with highest honors.

He's taught theology, philosophy, and biblical studies courses for over a decade and is a pastor with 15 years of experience working in a variety of denominational contexts.

Since 2017, he's hosted a podcast called "Deep Talks: Exploring Theology & Meaning-Making" helping people explore the intersection of theology with all of our efforts to find and make meaning in the world.
Available wherever you subscribe to podcasts.
